question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What position did Pete Visclosky hold in 2026?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Pete Visclosky

Pete Visclosky is an American politician who has served as a United States representative since 1985. Early Life and Education

Pete Visclosky was born on August 13, 1949, in Gary, Indiana. He earned a Bachelor of Science degree in Accounting from Indiana University Northwest in 1970 and a Juris Doctor degree from Notre Dame Law School in 1973. Political Career

Visclosky began his political career in 1979 as a staffer for U.S. Representative Adam Benjamin Jr. After Benjamin's death in 1982, Visclosky worked as a staffer for U.S. Representative Katie Hall. In 1984, Visclosky ran for the U.S. House of Representatives in Indiana's 1st congressional district, which includes parts of Lake County and Porter County. He won the Democratic primary and went on to defeat Republican candidate Joseph P. McNamara in the general election. Since then, Visclosky has been re-elected 17 times, most recently in 2020. During his tenure, he has served on several committees, including the Committee on Appropriations, the Committee on Defense, and the Committee on Energy and Commerce. As a representative, Visclosky has focused on issues related to economic development, education, and healthcare. He has also been a strong advocate for the steel industry and has worked to promote American manufacturing. Evidence of Holding the Position of United States Representative

* According to the official website of the U.S. House of Representatives, Pete Visclosky is currently serving as the representative for Indiana's 1st congressional district. [1]
* Visclosky's biography on the website of the Committee on Appropriations lists him as a member of the committee and notes his service in the U.S. House of Representatives since 1985. [2]
* A 2020 article in The Times of Northwest Indiana reported on Visclosky's re-election to the U.S. House of Representatives, citing his victory in the general election. [3]
* The Federal Election Commission's website lists Visclosky as a candidate for the U.S. House of Representatives in multiple election cycles, including 2018 and 2020. [4]

References:

[1] U.S. House of Representatives. (n.d.). Representative Pete Visclosky.

Title: The Unlikely Administrator

January 2024

Pete Visclosky, a seasoned American politician, stood outside the grand Prefecture of Oise in Beauvais, France, clutching a worn leather briefcase and gazing up at the imposing stone fa√ßade. He couldn't help but feel a sense of trepidation as he prepared to take on the role of General Secretary, a position he had never imagined he'd hold. The French officials, with their impeccable manners and precision, seemed a world away from the rough-and-tumble politics of his native Indiana. As he entered the building, Pete was greeted by the outgoing General Secretary, Monsieur Dupont, who presented him with a stern-faced welcome. "Bonjour, Monsieur Visclosky. I trust you are prepared to assume the responsibilities of this esteemed position?" Pete nodded, trying to hide his uncertainty. The first few weeks were a blur of meetings, introductions, and policy briefings. Pete struggled to keep up with the intricacies of French bureaucracy, but his natural charm and willingness to learn soon won over his colleagues. By the end of January, he had begun to find his footing, and the Prefecture's staff started to warm up to the American interloper. February 2024

As Pete delved deeper into his role, he discovered the complexities of managing the Oise region's affairs. From coordinating with local mayors to overseeing infrastructure projects, he worked tirelessly to prove himself. His fluency in French, though imperfect, helped him connect with the people he served. The once-skeptical officials began to appreciate his unique perspective, shaped by his experiences in the United States. March 2024

Spring brought new challenges as Pete navigated the intricacies of French politics. He found himself mediating disputes between rival factions and brokering deals to benefit the region. His diplomatic skills, honed during his years in Congress, served him well in this delicate dance. The people of Oise began to notice the positive changes, and Pete's popularity grew. Summer 2024

As the sun-kissed days of summer arrived, Pete felt a sense of accomplishment wash over him. He had successfully implemented several initiatives, including a program to revitalize the region's struggling agricultural sector. The Prefecture's staff had become a well-oiled machine, with Pete at the helm. He began to feel a sense of belonging, and the French officials started to regard him as one of their own.

answer: General Secretary of the Prefecture of Oise
